intro: Bupleurum trichopodum f. luxurians, commonly known as the luxuriant threepod bupleurum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Bupleurum genus.
